meanings.definition: A group of people living together in a semicolonial relationship.
meanings.sent1: The small community formed a semicolonies to support each other.
meanings.sent2: The semicolonies worked together to build a better future for all residents.
meanings.sent3: In the semicolonies, they had weekly potlucks to strengthen their bond.
meanings.sent4: The semicolonies were like a big family, always looking out for one another.
meanings.sent5: Living in the semicolonies felt like being part of a close-knit village.

meanings.definition: A settlement or territory under the control or influence of a larger power.
meanings.sent1: The island was considered a semicolonies of the mainland country.
meanings.sent2: The semicolonies were subject to the laws of the ruling nation.
meanings.sent3: The semicolonies thrived under the protection of the powerful kingdom.
meanings.sent4: Being part of the semicolonies meant following the rules set by the dominant authority.
meanings.sent5: Living in the semicolonies meant adapting to the customs of the ruling nation.
